session.name: Putting the Customer First: Jobs-to-be-Done
session.description: Lean and agile methodologies focus on small batches and quick iterations. But if you don't know what your customers are trying to achieve you are just competing against luck, hoping that one of your gambles will stick. People hire companies to do a job, by focusing on your customer's Jobs-to-be-Done you can be more focused in your iterations and get the elusive product-market fit sooner.

session.name: Value Stream Mapping & the Improvement Kata
session.description: Taking the learnings form Lean manufacturing we can help to improve any process and the products that we are building to support these processes. Mapping the current process focusing on Lead Time, Process Time, and Percent Complete and Accurate. Pick the areas where there is the largest opportunity for improvement.

session.name: Boring Deployments
session.description: Automated, Zero downtime, Hot/Cold, Roll Backs etc.

session.name: Mission Command vs Command and Control
Incremental Metrics: Getting your KPI's Right
session.description:
Breaking down the core metric to be changed into smaller pieces to enable incremental delivery. 

How to do it and examples of it done well

Planning your Agile Architecture
session.description: Setup decisions: Planning your Agile architecture (Cloud migration path, platform choice, microservices/conainer architecture) ... Before you know everything about your product, how are you supposed to set it up

session.description: Marketing Product / Features (Growth Hacking) - Good quote: Eng work on long term growth, marketing on immediate growth
